alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 6:46PM CDT until June 06 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Marshall County in central Illinois... Southeastern Stark County in north central Illinois... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 644 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Between 4 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in parts of eastern Stark County and northern Marshall County. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lacon, Henry, Wyoming, Toulon, Varna, Camp Grove, Castleton, Marshall-Putnam County Fairgrounds and Lake Wildwood. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
